Description: Body sherd of Chian Mature Animal Style pottery chalice; discoloured white slip; interior: glazed streaky black; traces of two added white bands; exterior: painted decoration consisting of bull (muzzle, neck, trace of shoulder and part of raised foreleg remaining), to right; at far right, possible tip of lion's snout; elaborate rosette and curled swastika as filling ornament.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 255, no. 446, pl. 60)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0519) (phase 2)
